INLINE bool operator!= ( const Vector2 &  v1,
const Vector2 &  v2 
)

This function returns whether or not two vectors are not equal.

Two vectors are considered equal if all of their corresponding elements are equal.

Returns:
True if the input vectors are not equal, otherwise false.

INLINE bool operator< ( const Vector2 &  v1,
const Vector2 &  v2 
)

This function returns whether or not the vector on the left is less than the vector on the right.

A vector is considered less than another if its x element is less than the other. Or if the x elements are equal, then the y elements are compared.

Returns:
True if the input vectors are not equal, otherwise false.

INLINE bool operator== ( const Vector2 &  v1,
const Vector2 &  v2 
)

This function returns whether or not two vectors are equal.

Two vectors are considered equal if all of their corresponding elements are equal.

Returns:
True if the input vectors are equal, otherwise false.
